core.grammar.GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl

Uses of GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl in core.grammar
 

Methods in core.grammar that throw GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl
 Derivation DerivationImpl.getMaxRandomDerivation(int maxDepthGlobal, NonTerminal nt)
           
 Derivation Derivation.getMaxRandomDerivation(int maxDepthGlobal, NonTerminal nt)
          Returns a new Grammar's Derivation, using the symbol nt as the starting point, that is: the Productions that have nt as the left symbol are selected, and one of them is selected in a random way.
 Derivation DerivationImpl.getMaxRandomDerivationWithFunction(int maxDepthGlobal, NonTerminal nt, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> features, Function f, java.lang.String symbol, int symbol2_pos)
           
 Derivation Derivation.getMaxRandomDerivationWithFunction(int maxDepthGlobal, NonTerminal nt, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> features, Function F, java.lang.String s, int s2_pos)
          The function has the same behavior that the function "getMaxRandomDerivation", and it has been added with the following additional feature: given an Element (e) with the symbol "s" associated, the function adds to the Derivation's e node the following two items: 1) A new function f, that is obtained through the parameter F ( F.createFunction ).
